chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael J. Graham was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Michael J. Graham was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  Absolute sobriety.  78 days credit if revoked.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J. Graham in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda A. Hoffman and intern Rick Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
4 years  Probation, Consecutive to Ct. 2 
Provide DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Absolute Sobriety
$468.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
78 days credit if probation revoked
Court imposes sentence.

Count 2: 
$1694.00 fine, thru probation
$25 blood draw cost, thru probation
9 mos.  in Sauk County Jail, with huber (WAIVED first 48 hours), consecutive, with good time
203 days credit   TIME SERVED
36 months Driver License revocation
AODA (Set up with Clerk of Court's office after court)
Ignition Interlock

Count 3 & 4:  Dismissed but read in
Paperwork handed in court.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael J. Graham by video from LEC with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Michael J. Graham in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Atty Woodard states Atty Martinez will represent him in this matter.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Woodard responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $2,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances unless he has a valid prescription, not to operate MV w/o valid DL and must submit to breath test if operating a MV and requested to do so by law enforcement.
